intro: Monnina dictyocarpa, commonly known as the velvetleaf monnina, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are opposite and have a distinctive velvety texture, while its stems are usually sprawling or prostrate. Monnina dictyocarpa is adapted to arid environments and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
